greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Reverse the nonzero digits of n.
comment: This sequence is a self-inverse permutation of nonnegative integers.
See A321464 for the ternary variant.
This sequence has similarities with A069799: here we reverse nonzero digits, there we reverse nonzero prime exponents.
link: Rémy Sigrist, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
example: - so we replace the first nonzero digit by the third, the third by the first (and the second remains in place),
program: (PARI) a(n, base=10) = my (d=digits(n, base), t=Vecrev(select(sign, d)), i=0); for (j=1, #d, if (d[j], d[j] = t[i++])); fromdigits(d, base)
results.author: _Rémy Sigrist_, Nov 11 2018
